Comment.val: /*Gets the first period to be calculated.*/

/*Is the first calculation which potentially triggers calculations of following periods. Is used to determine which calculation variant to use to determine the first calculation period. Next calculations always use the given calculation variant to determine the period. Variants 3 Proforma always uses variant 3 to determine the period. The rest of the variants use the max period of calculations of variants 1,4,5 for the determination of the period for the first calculation.*/
/*Start date of which the calculation of charges takes place (PRODUCT_FEE_LINES.START_DATE).*/
/*End date up and until which the calculation of charges takes place. (PRODUCT_FEE_LINES.END_DATE)*/
/*Date up to and including which the calculation must be executed. When skipped or when a given reference date is greater than today, yesterday is used.*/
/*TRUE = period will be maximized by the given ReferenceDate. FALSE=Only period endings compliant to the calculation frequency and before the given ReferenceDate are returned.*/
/*DOORBELHEADER.DH_PERIODE_FREQUENTI . (J)aar,(K)wartaal OR (M)aand. The frequency after which a calculation is executed. */
/*DOORBELHEADER.CHARGE_FREQUENCY (K)wartaal,(J)aar OR (A)s calculation. The frequency after which the calculated fee is charged.*/
/*Calculated Fee Header Id of which the processing triggered the current calculation. Only relevant for asynchronic processing.*/
/*TRUE when a new calculation period is found.*/
/*Start date of the first period to be calculated.*/
/*End date of the first period to be calculated.*/
/*TRUE : PeriodEndDate does NOT correspond to the end date of the calculation frequency.*/
/*TRUE : PeriodEndDate lies within the last calculation frequency of the charging frequency.*/
/*TRUE as long as the reference date is after the PeriodEndDate AND the reference date is also after the next PeriodEndDate OR an intermediate period is allowed.*/

Text.val: When calculation frequency and charge frequency differ from each other multiple calculations will be charged in one charge.
If that's the case, existing calculations will be taken into account even if they are only calculated
(SERVICEFEE_HDR.RECORD_STATE >=1) , if that's not the case existing calculations must at least been

SQL_STMT_U.val: select max(period_till) from servicefee_hdr h inner join servicefee_calc_run r on h.sfcr_id=r.id where h.ppr_id=~1 and h.charge_type= ~2 and ((~4=3 and r.calculation_variant=3) or (~3=1 and ~4<>3 and r.calculation_variant IN (1,4,5)) or (~3=0 and r.calculation_variant=~4)) and ((h.proces_state = 0 and h.record_state>=~6) or (h.record_state>=5 and h.proces_state = 9) or (~5 is not null and h.cfh_id=~5))

Text.val: Query determines the last calculated or processed period
Always include the triggering calculated fee header, regardless of the process status.
No Calculated or Processed periods found, then the feeChargeStartDate else last calculation period plus one day :
Check if the next period is present and ready to be calculated:
Check if it's the last period of the charge period:

ExpSyntax.val: FlwMtr('Start period maximized due to setting. New startdate period : ' & DStr({1,1345323013},'DD-MM-YYYY'),'FALSE'LOG)
